comment.author: 83025347@N00
comment._content: Interesting how even a cheap house back then could have two chimneys, dormers, soffits, porches, a front door, and other architectural details often considered superfluous today.

comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: Carl Mydans, with camera: www.loc.gov/pictures/item/98507850/

comment.author: 44495293@N00
comment._content: Chimneys would be necessary for whatever heating device was installed - while you can get away without indoor plumbing, you still have to head the place somehow. As for the doormers, I suspect it would be so that those sleeping in the attic might have some sort of illumination.
